messageBody:
> > What's a better approach - isolate each method and test accordingly,
> > or test at the class level?
>
> Between those two, I generally test methods, but really, I test
> /behaviors/, most of which I implement with a single method. In this
> case, testing behaviors and testing methods is essentially the same.
>
> A classic example of when I need to test behavior instead of methods is
> a Stack. You don't really test push(), but rather test peek() and pop()
> using push(), and this is how we know push() works. One test, then,
> might be check that after pushing into an empty stack, I can peek at the
> top item. One could argue this tests push, or peek, or both. I don't
> care which. What I generally care about is that push, peek and pop work
> on an empty stack.


+1 Then the trick becomes naming the test well.
